meanings.sent1: The priest will reconsecrate the church after the renovations are complete.
meanings.sent2: It is important to reconsecrate the altar before the ceremony.
meanings.sent3: The children decided to reconsecrate their secret hideout as a 'no adults allowed' zone.
meanings.sent4: After the storm, the community came together to reconsecrate their bond and rebuild.
meanings.sent5: The ancient ritual was performed to reconsecrate the sacred ground.

meanings.definition: To make or declare sacred again
meanings.sent1: The elders will reconsecrate the ancient temple to restore its spiritual significance.
meanings.sent2: The ceremony aims to reconsecrate the sacred relics that were desecrated.
meanings.sent3: The family decided to reconsecrate their annual tradition of baking cookies together.
meanings.sent4: The artist sought to reconsecrate the abandoned church by turning it into a beautiful art gallery.
meanings.sent5: The ritual dance was performed to reconsecrate the sacred land to the spirits.
